    Current Projects

    • CONTRIBUTE

      These maps will be used to as part of an ongoing urban resilience project by the American Red Cross that focuses on disaster and disease prevention and mitigation. The American Red Cross will be doing on the ground mapping in... read more.

    • CONTRIBUTE

      The Missing Maps project aims to map the most vulnerable places in the world (affected by humanitarian crises. disease epidemics, conflict, natural disasters, poverty, environmental crises). Building on HOT's disaster preparedness projects, the Missing Maps tasks facilitate pre-emptive mapping of... read more.

      Please follow instructions regarding mapping roads in this task. Annual flooding and recurring drought have devastating impacts on communities in Southern Africa. In the Zambezi River basin, seasonal weather patterns often result in crop failure, shelter damage, livestock death, soil... read more.

    • CONTRIBUTE

      Please follow instructions regarding mapping roads in this task. Annual flooding and recurring drought have devastating impacts on communities in Southern Africa. In the Zambezi River basin, seasonal weather patterns often result in crop failure, shelter damage, livestock death, soil... read more.

    • CONTRIBUTE

      This project supports Médecins Sans Frontières’ operation in Mwenzei, Zimbabwe. The MSF team and their cartographer in the field are using maps to plan their operations. MSF needs a map displaying medical outreach points, health facilities and other relevant information... read more.
